description.narrative: Kordsa Teknik Tekstil A.S. (Kordsa Turkey) and its subsidiaries (together with Kordsa Turkey, Kordsa) is a leading Turkish group involved in the production of industrial nylon & polyester yarn, tire cord fabric and single end cord in addition to composite and construction reinforcement materials. The proposed IFC investment is up to US$110 million to fund (i) Kordsas investment program that will be undertaken in emerging markets between 2022 and 2025 to scale up research and development activities, acquire technology, improve operational efficiency and grow product capabilities in high margin products and (ii) increased permanent working capital need (the Project). Up to 25% of the proposed IFC investment will be utilized by Kordsa Inc., a wholly owned subsidiary of Kordsa Turkey in the US, for technology acquisitions. This component will benefit Kordsas operations in various emerging markets, such as Turkey, Brazil, Indonesia and Thailand.

The Project's expected development impacts include (i) higher export generation with increased sales, higher taxes; (ii) improved competitiveness of Kordsa; and (iii) job preservation and creation with skill development in a highly technical industry.
